g.H4941: properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, ...
g.H5352: to be (or make) clean (literally or figuratively); by implication (in an adverse sense) to be bare, i.e. extirpated
